messages.message:
FYI to all — just memorializing a medium-term decision about ACLs and UDF access.
Chatted with @Heymian (cc: @Aaron Vontell):

We decided to use ACL bit -> app:refiner -> write as the guard for all checks on whether a person has UDF access.
The long-term option will be to add an Org Level option which allows for someone to get access to UDFs. That concept doesn’t exist yet in Infra land — so Heymian anticipates that work to be 2 - 3 months away.

Hence — to move away from is_site_admin (in places like Custom Classifier) — we will use app:refiner can_write permission bit with our ACL system. Here is an example of how we use that today:

https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/distributed-tasks/celery/app-tasks/src/py/instabase/tasks/apps/train_refiner_util.py#L327

Please let us know if you have any thoughts on the decision
Just adding @Jessica as an fyi who’s starting to figure out how to revamp our ACL stuff. :slightly_smiling_face:
